sen.e: However, as his mother was a daughter of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, Tadasato's younger brother Tadatomo was allowed to succeed the head through the good offices of bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.e: Being influenced by his lawful wife, who was a religious person, he reigned peaceful times and left achievements such as construction and relocation of temples (he was a tyrant according to some hypothesis, but they are all stereotypical and not convincing).

sen.e: Consequently, his old retainers such as Fukunishi, Seki, Oka, and Shiga were expelled and banished, and further, Satoie GAMO, the younger brother of the chief retainer Satoyoshi GAMO, was given free time and was deprived of his official rank.

sen.j: ようやく家中の安定を見、安心を得たと思われたが、寛永11年（1634年）、参勤交代の途上、京都の藩邸で急死してしまう。
sen.e: Although it seemed that the domain finally reached stability and security, Tadatomo died suddenly at his residence in Kyoto during Sankinkotai (a system under which feudal lords in the Edo period were required to spend every other year in residence in Edo) in 1634.

tit.j: 蒲生忠知にまつわる怪奇話

sen.j: 忠知の死により近江蒲生氏の系統は断絶したがこれはタタリが遠因となったという巷説がある。
sen.e: Tadatomo's death resulted in the end of the line of the Omi Gamo clan, which is said to be caused by a curse.

sen.cmt: 原文には 「蒲生氏近江蒲生氏」とありましたが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「近江蒲生氏」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出し、原文修正しました。
sen.e: Tadatomo's death resulted in the end of the line of the Omi-Gamo clan, which is said to be caused by a curse.

sen.j: 忠知が藩主の座を継いで以降世継ぎの男子が生まれないまま時を重ねていたが、やがて藩内の妊婦に憎悪を向けることとなり妊婦を捕まえては腹を割き母子共々殺害するという惨劇を繰り返していたという。
sen.e: While remaining to have no male heir after succeeding the position of the lord of the domain, Tadatomo began to have hatred against pregnant women in the domain and caused appalling tragedies, repeatedly killing fetuses and mothers by cutting open mother's abdomen.
